**Not Taric Main**: "Star Guardian, more Star Pimp Lord am I-"

**Me**: "No, Taric is man who respects woman you fucking newb!"
Lol agreed. If any one is a Star Pimp Lord, it'd be Draaaaaaven

Thank goodness someone else who actually plays him.  I've started to practice a lot with him and I agree that he doesn't need that skin.

I mean, if they really want it anyways, those boots on Armor of the Fifth age already do it.
Low variety in roles but okay.

Kayle is basically a Marksman or "APC" (AP Carry)
Taric is a support
Vi and Riven are both Fighters/Slayer
Karma is a Mage but can also be flexed as support

I think thats a teamcomp that could work just fine in a normal game but maybe thats just me.

Kayle could never replace a Marksman. She's lower damage and slower for most of the game. Her abilities are quite shit to be fair aswell in comparison and since she's AP, she has no item variety.

She's gameplay-wise just not comparable aside from spam E + basic attack.

You can absolutely build Kayle as an AD marksman. She has innate shred, some extra magic damage on hit, and stupidly strong waveclear.

The two big disadvantages are short range (she only has 525 with her E active instead of the more typical 550) and the need to build essence reaver before she's ready to fight.

Is she going to pull an AD caster-esque "use two abilities and knock off 80% of a target's health" stunt? No. But her ult makes her the bane of a lot of assassins and it's hard to counter-build her.

> You can absolutely build Kayle as an AD marksman. She has innate shred, some extra magic damage on hit, and stupidly strong waveclear.

BUILD AD on Kayle?? Her E scales only with AP. You want her to go at people into melee range? That'd throw out the only good ability in her kit that gives her some safety.

Her ult is a Support ability. It doesn't mean she has enough damage to kill an assassin during the ult. A Zed could take care of her if she isn't full build because Full Build Kayle is the only thing that can be a threat. She's pretty bad until late game as i said.

You can make a ton of items to counter her. {{item:3001}} and she'll basically be giving you mana{{item:3194}}  and even {{item:3110}}  to reduce her attack speed. There are other MR items that work but i'm not going to list them all.

Her E just empowers her autoattacks. They're still autoattacks, which means they do 100% of AD as physical damage to her target. They just happen to also do 60+0.3x AP magic damage on hit, travel instantly, and proc spell effects in addition to on-hit effects. Hell, AD Kayle does *more* damage than AP Kayle - it's just that she loses most her W's utility to get it. Her Q scales with AD (at pretty much exactly the same rate, once you factor in the gold efficiency differences), and her E has similar scaling on the splash damage (although AP does pull ahead at VERY high amounts).

With the addition of Essence Reaver and Adaptive Helm, there are pretty much zero reasons to run AP Kayle these days. Adaptive Helm doesn't affect AA damage, which is where AD Kayle's DPS comes from, and Essence Reaver grants mana and the CDR that she normally gets from Nashor's.

As for attack speed slows hurting her... yes, that's true, but they hurt *every* AA-based champion. That's sort of like saying that armor hurts ADCs, or health makes it hard to burst people. Kayle is hard to counterbuild because she has built-in shred and does a decent amount of mixed damage even in an AD heavy build.
Have never, ever seen a strong AD Kayle. Propably because that first statement is simply not true.

I'm going to go ahead and quote the Righteous Fury ability from the client here:

Passive: Grants Kayle on- Hit magic Damage.
Activate: Ignite Kayle's sword with a holy flame, granting Kayle a ranged attack that damages multiple enemies and deals bonus magic damage.

Here's the summary from the league of legends wiki:
PASSIVE: Kayle's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage.
ACTIVE: Kayle's basic attacks for the next 10 seconds has 525 range, deals increased bonus magic damage, deals magic damage to all enemies near the main target, though not against turrets, and applies spell effects.

While Righteous Fury is active, Kayle becomes a Ranged role ranged champion.

Bonus magic damage: 10 / 15 / 20 / 25 / 30 (+ 15% AP)
Increased bonus magic damage: 20 / 30 / 40 / 50 / 60 (+ 30% AP)
Splashing magic damage: 20 / 30 / 40 / 50 / 60 (+ 20 / 25 / 30 / 35 / 40% AD) (+ 30% AP)

TL;DR: Kayle does a basic attack. Her E adds on-hit magic damage. When activated, she gains range, doubles her bonus magic damage, and does splash damage.

It still counts as a basic attack, and still does 100% of AD as physical to the primary target.

Yeah but i've never tried going AD like that, i've seen people that have tried (who failed miserably) and even if you're (maybe) right then that's still a shit strategy to compare to a set of champions that are designed to be built AD as Ranged champions.

I mean compare all you want, but she'll never outclass any Adc in her current state.
Her E actually do scale with 40% AD on the splash damage, not that that changes much.
Well...yeah.
So is Ashe.
No? Her kit is designed around being an Adc with heavy self peel through positioning. Kayle's only defense is her W or R and her Q takes too long to cast to be a fair tradeoff.

Ashe is a utility carry, you don't pick Ashe for her raw damage, you would go MF or Jhin for that, you pick Ashe for all the other neat things she can bring to the fight. Why is Kayle not allowed to be a Utility Carry?

Because Kayle is not a carry. She's pretty shit in the current meta in general due to her outdated kit. She has a point & click slow, she has a MS heal and a point and click invulnerability for 2 seconds.

If i wanted this, i'd just play Ekko Top/Support. You'd pick Kayle even less for damage because she has none.

This SG Lineup has no Ranged AD.
SG Team 2 Doesn't have a Tank or a Jungler so who cares?
Yeah cuz they're unfortunately less popular so MF and Ahri stole those spots.
